intro: Chiococca coriacea, commonly known as the rough chiococca, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and elliptical leaves with a rough, textured surface. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Chiococca coriacea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and riverbanks.
